data.event: Belmont railway station opened in May 1865 and was originally called 'California Station', named after the California Arms public house on the opposite side of Brighton Road which was built by John Gibbons in approximately 1858.

event.title: was built by John Gibbons in approximately 1858

data.event: Belmont railway station opened in May 1865 and was originally called 'California Station', named after the California Arms public house on the opposite side of Brighton Road which was built by John Gibbons in approximately 1858.
The station was renamed 'Belmont' in 1875, and the name was attached to the village that emerged subsequently.
The new building, built on the site in 1955, was known as 'The Belmont', but in 2014, under new management, reverted to its original name of The 'California'.

event.title: was known as 'The Belmont', but in 2014

data.event: The new building, built on the site in 1955, was known as 'The Belmont', but in 2014, under new management, reverted to its original name of The 'California'.
